etymology.description: 说(說) (shuō, "speak") + 话(話) (huà, "speech; words") = to speak
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 说(說) (shuō, "speak") and 话(話) (huà, "speech; words") conveys the action of producing spoken words or engaging in verbal communication.

examples.chinese: 请小声说话(請小聲說話)。
他说话有趣(他說話有趣)，让人心情愉快(讓人心情愉快)。
examples.pinyin: tā shuōhuà yǒuqù, ràng rén xīnqíng yúkuài
examples.english: His way of speaking is interesting, making people feel happy.

examples.chinese: 能说话自信(能說話自信)，便能赢得尊重(便能贏得尊重)。
examples.pinyin: néng shuōhuà zìxìn, biàn néng yíngdé zūnzhòng
